H0.text: Insects are by far the most common type of invertebrate.

H1.text: Spiders are by far the most common type of invertebrate.

H2.text: Crustaceans are by far the most common type of invertebrate.

H3.text: Corals are by far the most common type of invertebrate.

A4.text: Insects constitute around half of all eukaryote species, including animals, plants, and fungi.

A5.text: The most diverse insect orders are the Hemiptera (true bugs), Lepidoptera (butterflies and moths), Diptera (true flies), Hymenoptera (wasps, ants, and bees), and Coleoptera (beetles), each with more than 100,000 described species.
